question1.question: Do I need an x-ray or a scan/ Can I have an x-ray or a scan?
question1.answer: While x-rays and scans can be useful diagnostic tools, they are not always necessary for managing your symptoms initially...

question2.question: How long would this take to get better?
question2.answer: Muscles tend to take 8-12 weeks to adapt and get stronger...

question3.question: Can I have a pain killing injection?
question3.answer: We advise to attempt the least invasive techniques before moving onto the more invasive options...

question4.question: Is Ice or Heat better for my injury?
question4.answer: The answer to this is 'Whatever works best for you'...

question5.question: How many times a day should I do the exercises?
question5.answer: Ideally, you want to complete these exercises at least once during the day...

question6.question: Can I continue my regular activities and sports?
question6.answer: Initially it is important to ensure you are close to being pain free...

question7.question: What should I do if my pain worsens?
question7.answer: Increased pain is not always necessarily an indicator of worsening anatomically...
